summary: William H. Cross was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is mentioned in several payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents list his name, position, and salary during that period. The documents indicate his continued employment with the HSCA during the specified timeframe.
significance: William H. Cross's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA, contributing to the committee's investigation into the JFK assassination. The payroll and certification documents provide a record of his employment and compensation during the HSCA's active period.
